prior_knowledge_digest: Students should have a basic understanding of language learning principles, such as the importance of vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation. Familiarity with the concept of inflected languages, where word endings change to convey meaning, will be beneficial. Additionally, students should be aware of the historical significance of Latin as the language of ancient Rome and its influence on modern languages.
misconception_watchlist: Assuming Latin pronunciation is the same as English
Confusing Latin word order with English syntax

primary: Introduce the Latin alphabet and pronunciation
Familiarize students with basic Latin greetings
Discuss the historical context of Latin

lesson_flow.description: Welcome students and introduce the course.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and respond to the teacher's greeting.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Set a positive tone for the course.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce the Latin alphabet and pronunciation.
lesson_flow.student_action: Repeat after the teacher and practice pronunciation.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use audio clips to demonstrate correct pronunciation.

lesson_flow.description: Practice basic Latin greetings with the class.
lesson_flow.student_action: Engage in pair work to practice greetings.

lesson_flow.description: Discuss the historical context of Latin.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and take notes on the significance of Latin.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Highlight Latin's influence on modern languages.

lesson_flow.description: Review key points and answer questions.
lesson_flow.student_action: Ask questions and reflect on the lesson.

lesson_flow.description: Reflect on the faith phrase 'In principio erat Verbum'.
lesson_flow.student_action: Discuss the phrase's meaning and significance.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Connect the phrase to the lesson's themes.
